meanings.definition: (adjective) (of a leaf) having leaflets arranged on opposite sides of a common axis
meanings.sent1: The bipinnate leaf had smaller leaflets growing on each side of the main stem.
meanings.sent2: The bipinnate leaves of the plant made it look very full and lush.
meanings.sent3: I saw a bipinnate leaf that looked like it was waving hello with its tiny leaflets.
meanings.sent4: The bipinnate structure of the leaf reminded me of a delicate butterfly's wings.
meanings.sent5: The bipinnate arrangement of the leaflets created a beautiful symmetrical pattern.

meanings.definition: (verb) to divide into two parts or branches
meanings.sent1: I will bipinnate the path ahead to explore both directions.
meanings.sent2: The river bipinnated into two streams, flowing in different directions.
meanings.sent3: Let's bipinnate our study group so we can cover more topics efficiently.
meanings.sent4: The decision to bipinnate the project led to increased productivity.
meanings.sent5: She chose to bipinnate her career, pursuing both art and science simultaneously.
